intro: Sunipia bifurcatoflorens, commonly known as the bifurcated-flowered sunipia, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive bifurcated (two-branched) flowers, which are typically pale yellow or white in color. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth, waxy surface. Sunipia bifurcatoflorens thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense forest undergrowth.
